metadata.synopsis: A woman (Emma Suárez) whose husband died during her pregnancy bonds with a gay man (Juan Diego Botto) she met while looking to reinvent her life.

reviews: A shameless, straightforward soap opera (no Almodovarian excess here!), but it's pretty entertaining on its own sudsy terms.
Bears some resemblance to All About My Mother, but lacks its compatriot's flamboyance, content to traffic in glib banalities and unwitting self-absorption.
Albacete, Menkes and co-writer Lucia Etxeberria have a good ear for dialogue, but demonstrate less certainty at creating a wealth of memorable characters or situations.
A thoughtful, well-acted and well-observed (though bleak) look at what some people have to put up with to get through life.
It transcends utter schlock by being charming and unapologetic about its unconventional romance.
